data.event: They then temporarily settled across the Missouri River at Sonora (now Watson, Missouri).
In 1857 a community formed around a trading post called Mount Vernon on the bluffs above the river on the Nebraska side.
In 1857 settlers founded Peru down the hill from Mount Vernon directly on the Missouri River.

event.title: 1861 a Methodist school called Mount Vernon Academy opened

data.event: In 1861 a Methodist school called Mount Vernon Academy opened.
In 1867 the school (which became Peru State College) became the state's first normal school.
An 1867 flood caused the Nebraska community of McKissick Island northeast of Peru to be surrounded by Missouri land and cause a border dispute that would not be resolved until 1999.
